title: Highest GNI per Capita
description: In 2015, Liechtenstein had a Gross National Income per capita of $137,688, making it one of the wealthiest countries in the world.

title: Exceptional Political Stability
description: As of 2023, Liechtenstein ranks in the 94.79th percentile for political stability and absence of violence, indicating a highly stable political environment.

title: High Researcher Density
description: In 2023, Liechtenstein had 18,130 researchers per million people, highlighting its strong focus on research and development.

title: Low Pupil-Teacher Ratio
description: In 2017, the pupil-teacher ratio in Liechtenstein's lower secondary education was 5.6, indicating a highly personalized education system.

title: Negative Foreign Direct Investment
description: In 2018, Liechtenstein experienced a net outflow of foreign direct investment amounting to -1303.11% of its GDP, suggesting challenges in attracting foreign investments.

title: Small Urban Population
description: As of 2023, Liechtenstein's urban population was only 5,825, reflecting its small size and limited urbanization.

title: Skewed Sex Ratio at Birth
description: In 2023, the sex ratio at birth in Liechtenstein was 1.163 male births per female birth, indicating a gender imbalance.
